meanings.definition: A person acknowledged as holy or virtuous.
meanings.sent1: The village celebrated the local saints with a feast.
meanings.sent2: Many people pray to saints for guidance and protection.
meanings.sent3: The children dressed up as saints for the school play.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity made her a saint in the eyes of the community.
meanings.sent5: The saints in the stained glass windows looked down upon the churchgoers.

meanings.definition: A member of the Christian Church who has been canonized.
meanings.sent1: The church honored the saints on All Saints' Day.
meanings.sent2: Saint Christopher is known as the patron saint of travelers.
meanings.sent3: The saints in heaven must be watching over us.
meanings.sent4: She felt a connection to the saints depicted in the paintings.
meanings.sent5: The saints' statues lined the walls of the cathedral, inspiring awe in visitors.

meanings.definition: A person of great holiness, virtue, or benevolence.
meanings.sent1: Her grandmother was a true saint, always helping others in need.
meanings.sent2: The community regarded him as a saint for his selfless acts.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to himself as the office saint for always fixing the printer.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was a saint for putting up with her antics.
meanings.sent5: The saint of the neighborhood, she was known for her endless charity work.
